intro: Scleromphalos, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique, often showy flowers that are adapted for specific pollination mechanisms. The plants typically grow in rocky or calcareous soils, showcasing their ability to thrive in challenging environments. Scleromphalos species are often found in Mediterranean regions, where they exhibit a range of morphological adaptations to withstand drought. Their botanical significance lies in their ecological role and their value in horticultural and conservation contexts.
